items.title: Australia bans DeepSeek on government devices
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The Australian government has banned DeepSeek, a Chinese AI firm, on government devices due to security concerns.
- The Department of Home Affairs issued the directive for immediate removal of DeepSeek products from government systems.
- Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke stated the ban is a national security measure, effective from Feb. 4, affecting only government entities, not private citizens.

items.title: Spotify reports $1.17b first annual profit for 2024
items.summary:
- Spotify has reported its first full year of profitability since 2008, with net profits of €1.14 billion (US$1.17 billion) for 2024.
- This profit marks a significant improvement from a loss of €532 million (US$549 million) the previous year.
- Total annual revenue for 2024 reached €15.6 billion (US$16.1 billion), up from €13.2 billion (US$13.6 billion) in 2023.
- Premium subscribers increased by 11% YoY, growing from 236 million to 263 million.
- Monthly active users rose by 12% to 675 million.

items.title: PayPal stock drops 10% due to slow growth, competition
items.summary:
- PayPal’s shares fell nearly 10% on Feb. 4 due to a slowdown in unbranded card processing growth.
- Fourth-quarter results showed a contraction in operating margins and a decline in unbranded payments growth to 2%.
- Branded products, including Venmo, grew by only 6%.
- Investor concerns heightened about maintaining strong profit margins amid competition from companies like Apple, Google, Visa, and Mastercard.

items.title: Gobi-Core Philippine Fund adds two startups to portfolio
items.summary:
- Gobi-Core Philippine Fund announced milestones for 2024, emphasizing its role in the local startup ecosystem.
- The fund added two companies, Humble Sustainability and ProCredit Financing Corp, to its portfolio.
- 80% of its Philippine portfolio companies reported valuation increases, contributing to a 52% year-on-year revenue growth.
- The fund organized a startup learning tour with the National Development Company to foster knowledge sharing and partnerships with Malaysian startups.

items.title: Tazapay aims to triple revenue in 2025 with stablecoin bet
items.author: Rahul Shinghal, Arul Kumaravel, Saroj Mishra
items.summary:
- Tazapay raised US$17 million in Series A funding led by Peak XV Partners in 2023.
- Revenue grew over 3x to US$6.2 million for the fiscal year ending March 2024.
- Despite growth, pre-tax losses widened by 16%, though losses as a percentage of revenue declined.
- The company aims to triple revenue to US$14 million in 2025, driven by stablecoin adoption.
- Tazapay, founded in 2020, serves clients in travel, fintech, ecommerce, online gaming, and SaaS industries.
- Launched multicurrency wallets for merchants and acquired a payment institution license in Singapore.

items.title: Taxi-hailing app HKTaxis to close in April
items.summary:
- HKTaxi will cease operations on April 1, 2025.
- Founded in 2013, the app has begun suspending user accounts and notifying users through the app.
- Users are encouraged to switch to Uber, with a promotional offer of HK$100 off their first five rides as part of the transition.

items.title: Ola Group’s AI firm launches first frontier research AI lab
items.summary:
- Krutrim, a leading AI company in India, has launched the Krutrim AI Lab as the country’s first AI frontier research lab.
- The initiative aims to advance AI research, develop models for Indic languages, and improve AI infrastructure needs.
- An initial investment of 2,000 crore rupees (US$230 million) has been made, with plans to invest a total of 10,000 crore rupees (US$1.15 billion) by 2026.
- The lab will collaborate with academic institutions, developers, and startups to promote AI research.
- It will focus on creating datasets for low-resource environments and tailoring AI systems to meet India's specific requirements.

items.title: SG-based Cocoon Capital commences fundraising for Fund III
items.summary:
- Cocoon Capital has started fundraising for Fund III, focusing on pre-seed and seed investments in B2B deeptech startups in Southeast Asia.
- Each investment can reach up to US$1.5 million, with plans for around five investments annually.
- The firm reviewed over 3,000 deals and expanded its reach to Australia, India, and Bangladesh.
- Portfolio companies have achieved significant milestones, such as Shomvob gaining over a million users shortly after funding.
- Several companies, including Transtrack and Aprisium, secured new funding rounds in 2024.
- Cocoon Capital will support early-stage startups and host events throughout 2025.

items.title: EFishery confirms alleged fraud, FTI Consulting takes over
items.summary:
- The board of Indonesian aquatech unicorn eFishery confirmed allegations of misconduct and fraud.
- FTI Consulting will take over as acting management after receiving shareholder approval.
- The company plans a thorough business review and has made difficult decisions regarding operational costs; the number of layoffs is currently unclear.

items.title: Indian data center firm unveils genAI chatbot using DeepSeek
items.summary:
- Yotta Data Services has launched myShakti, India’s first sovereign B2C generative AI chatbot.
- myShakti is built using the open-source DeepSeek AI model and operates entirely on Indian servers for data security.
- It was developed in four days using 128 H100 GPUs at the NM1 data center, aiming to democratize AI access while addressing national data sovereignty.

items.title: Airbus hires Goldman for new space venture to rival Musk
items.summary:
- Airbus SE is collaborating with Goldman Sachs to establish a new European space and satellite company.
- The venture aims to compete with SpaceX and involves partnership with Thales and Leonardo SpA.
- Known as Project Bromo, this initiative is currently in the exploratory phase without a finalized service portfolio.
- The move reflects an increasing urgency within Europe’s aerospace sector to consolidate resources in response to SpaceX's advancements.

items.title: Vietnam puts its chips on AI
items.summary:
- Vietnam has launched the Investment Support Fund to attract global investments in AI and semiconductors.
- The fund offers unique incentives, such as lower capital requirements for AI data centers and semiconductor firms.
- Companies that provide training for high-skilled engineers may receive additional incentives, including direct reimbursement for R&D and training costs.
- Challenges remain in attracting tech giants due to talent shortages, infrastructure issues, and regulatory uncertainties.

items.title: MobiKwik reports $6.35m loss in Q3
items.summary:
- MobiKwik reported a consolidated net loss of 55.28 crore rupees (US$6.35 million) for Q3 FY25.
- This loss marks a significant decline from a profit of 5.27 crore rupees (US$607) in the same period last year.
- The company's net loss increased from 3.59 crore rupees (US$427) in the previous quarter.
- EBITDA was a loss of 42.67 crore rupees (US$4.92 million), down from a profit of 10.82 crore rupees (US$1.25 million) in Q3 FY24.
- Operating revenue grew nearly 18% year-on-year to 269.47 crore rupees (US$31.16 million) from 228.93 crore rupees (US$26.39 million) in the previous year.

items.title: Zomato shares fall 4%
items.summary:
- Zomato’s shares fell nearly 4% during intraday trading on Feb. 4, reaching 229.35 rupees (US$2.63) on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
- The drop resulted in a market capitalization of 2,24,032 crore rupees (US$25.75 billion), with over 2.28 crore (22.8 million) shares traded by 11:58 AM.
- Year to date, Zomato’s stock has declined by about 16%.
- Shares recovered slightly, trading 2.5% lower at 232.05 rupees (US$2.66) each on the BSE by the time of this report.

items.title: Grab, GoTo in talks for potential merger by 2025: sources
items.summary:
- Grab Holdings Ltd. and GoTo Group are in advanced discussions for a potential merger by the end of 2025.
- Both companies are key players in Southeast Asia’s ride-hailing market, which serves over 650 million consumers.
- The merger aim is to reduce costs and address competition amid increasing financial pressures.
- Past negotiations faced challenges due to disagreements and antitrust concerns.

items.title: Meet the 100 top-funded startups and tech companies in China
Nintendo profit misses forecast, cuts Switch sales outlook
items.summary:
- Nintendo reported Q3 fiscal results for December 2024, with revenue at 432.92 billion yen, missing projections.
- Net profit dropped 6% year-on-year to 128.53 billion yen, also below forecasts.
- The company cut its full-year Switch sales forecast to 11 million units and lowered net profit outlook by 10%. 
- Nintendo is focusing on its next-gen console, tentatively named Switch 2, with details expected on April 2.

items.title: Asia tech stocks rise as Trump pauses Canada, Mexico tariffs
items.summary:
- Asian technology stocks gained on Feb. 4 after President Trump paused tariffs on Mexico and delayed Canadian tariffs for one month.
- This decision led to a recovery in US tech stocks late on Feb. 3.
- Semiconductor companies in Japan drove the rally, with TSMC and Foxconn up by 2.8%.
- South Korean tech stocks and Chinese tech giants in Hong Kong also performed strongly.
- Gains occurred despite ongoing tariff concerns, with US tariffs on China still in effect.

items.title: Google Integrates Chat Messaging with Search App in India
items.summary:
- Google launched a pilot program in India integrating RCS with the Google Search app.
- Users can connect with businesses through AI chat or live agents via SMS.
- RCS enhances SMS with multimedia features like images and location sharing.
- Union Bank of India is among the first to test this service.
- The initiative could strengthen RCS as a competitor to WhatsApp in India's messaging market.
- Google is also expanding its presence in India with various initiatives.

items.title: Priyanka Gill resigns from Kalaari Capital to launch own brand
items.summary:
- Priyanka Gill has decided to resign from her position at Kalaari Capital.
- She plans to start her own brand following her departure.
- The move indicates a shift in her career towards entrepreneurship.

items.title: Kakao partners with OpenAI to integrate AI into messaging
items.summary:
- Kakao Corp. partners with OpenAI to integrate ChatGPT and AI services into KakaoTalk.
- Announcement made during OpenAI CEO Sam Altman’s visit to Seoul.
- Focus on developing joint products and applying OpenAI’s technology across Kakao’s platforms.
- Partnership aims to commercialize AI and collaborate with local tech firms.
- Altman is touring Asia and announced a similar partnership with SoftBank in Tokyo.
- Plans to meet with tech leaders from SK Group, SK Telecom, SK Hynix, and Samsung Electronics.

items.title: Indian EV firms extend range to SEA
items.summary:
- Indian EV startups are expanding into Southeast Asia, driven by sector growth and potential market opportunities.
- Companies like Kazam, Zypp, and Exicom are entering a region dominated by Chinese brands.
- Indonesia has been noted as both a promising and challenging market, with BYD capturing 36% market share in just seven months.
- Electric vehicle sales in Indonesia have risen significantly, with EV cars reaching 5% of the total car sales in 2024.
- Local preferences for 7-seater vehicles influence market strategies, with BYD introducing the M6 model to cater to these needs.

items.title: 50 rising startups in China
items.summary:
- The article highlights a list of startups in China that have recently raised funding rounds.
- The focus is on companies up to the series E funding stage.
- The list is updated constantly based on data aggregated by Tech in Asia.

items.title: China to investigate Google for antitrust case
items.summary:
- China has initiated an antitrust investigation into Google.
- The investigation is part of a broader scrutiny of foreign tech firms operating in China.
- Google has faced criticism over its dominance in various markets, prompting regulatory concerns.

items.title: Stripe appoints new head of startup and VC partnerships
items.summary:
- Asya Bradley appointed as head of Stripe’s Startup and Venture Capital Partnerships program.
- Announcement made on Feb. 2, joined Stripe in November.
- Stripe partners with venture capital firms and startup accelerators.
- Bradley's previous roles include chief revenue officer at Synapse and vice president of revenue at Sila.
- She is a limited partner in several funds and on the investment committee for the Cap Table Coalition.
- Recent Stripe developments include job cuts and acquisitions, including a $1 billion deal for stablecoin platform Bridge.

items.title: Oyo to invest $60m in premium UK hotels
items.summary:
- OYO plans to invest £50 million (US$60 million) in premium hotels over three years, aiming to create 1,000 jobs in the hospitality sector.
- The company will acquire premium properties through long-term leases and management contracts, targeting deals with hotel chains and real estate firms.
- Since entering the UK in 2018, OYO has operated over 200 budget hotels and now aims to add 40+ premium hotels by the end of the year, with 18 already added.

items.title: Accel backs Indian AI firm as ‘ChatGPT for presentations’
items.summary:
- Accel has invested in an Indian AI startup that aims to be a ‘ChatGPT for presentations’. 
- The firm focuses on simplifying the presentation creation process using AI technology. 
- This investment reflects growing interest in AI-driven solutions within the presentation industry.

items.title: OpenAI’s Altman says ‘no plans’ to sue DeepSeek
items.author: Sam Altman
items.summary:
- OpenAI CEO Sam Altman stated that the company will not pursue legal action against DeepSeek.
- This decision comes amid discussions regarding DeepSeek's innovative chatbot.
- DeepSeek’s chatbot received attention for its capabilities but faced scrutiny for possible replicating OpenAI's ChatGPT.
- Altman made this announcement during a press conference in Tokyo on February 3.
- OpenAI is focused on advancing its AI models rather than legal matters with competitors.
- There are concerns regarding distillation techniques being used by competitors to imitate larger AI systems.

items.title: Temu parent PDD’s stock falls as Trump imposes tariffs
items.summary:
- PDD Holdings, the parent company of Temu, saw a significant decline in stock prices after tariffs were imposed by Trump.
- The market reaction was swift, reflecting investor concerns about potential impacts on costs and operations.
- This move could further strain US-China trade relations, with implications for e-commerce and international business strategies.

items.title: Tesla shares drop 5% on Trump tariffs, EU registration dip
items.summary:
- Tesla's shares fell by 5% due to impending tariffs from Trump administration.
- The company faced a decline in new vehicle registrations in Europe.
- Analysts express concerns over the long-term impact of these developments.

items.title: Shein under EU investigation for consumer law violations
items.summary:
- The European Commission is investigating Shein for potential illegal product sales and consumer law violations.
- Regulators from four EU member states are participating in the investigation.
- The probe will utilize the Consumer Protection Cooperation Network to enforce consumer rules online.
- Companies found in violation may face fines imposed by national regulators.
- Shein has committed to cooperating with the investigation.
- This investigation follows similar actions against Temu and Apple for consumer protection issues last year.

items.title: Meta unveils AI risk management framework
items.summary:
- Meta has introduced a new AI risk management framework aimed at addressing the potential harms associated with AI technologies.
- The framework includes strategies for identifying and mitigating risks in AI deployment.
- This initiative is part of Meta's broader commitment to responsible AI development and usage.

items.title: Intel delays AI chip designed to rival Nvidia
items.summary:
- Intel has halted the commercial launch of its Falcon Shores AI processor.
- The chip will now be used only as an internal test platform.
- Falcon Shores was initially designed to compete with Nvidia and was set for release in 2024.

items.title: Data firm Palantir shares jump 22% on strong Q4 earnings
items.summary:
- Palantir Technologies shares rose 22% after reporting Q4 earnings surpassing Wall Street estimates.
- Q1 revenue expected between $858 million and $862 million, exceeding estimates of $799 million.
- Full year sales projection of $3.74 billion to $3.76 billion, higher than the $3.52 billion forecast.
- Q4 revenue increased by 36% year-over-year; US commercial sales grew by 64% and US government revenue by 45%.
- CEO Alex Karp attributed growth to AI advancements, indicating Palantir's role in the AI revolution.
- US commercial sales projected to reach $1.08 billion by 2025.

items.title: In startup finance, fintech is in, but banks aren’t out
items.summary:
- Startups often fail due to cash flow issues, with studies showing that 16% of failures are related to financial mismanagement.
- Traditional banks are often seen as rigid and slow, hindering startup growth due to lengthy processes and outdated systems.
- Fintech platforms like Aspire, Airwallex, and Brex offer faster, more flexible financial tools to meet startup needs, but there are concerns over their maturity and security.

items.title: Apple raises concerns over porn app under EU digital law
items.summary:
- Apple raised concerns regarding the EU’s Digital Markets Act due to a porn app, HotTub, available on AltStore PAL for iPhone.
- Apple denied approval of the app and emphasized it does not allow such content on its App Store, only checking for malware and compatibility.
- Apple reported its concerns to the European Commission but has not received a response and fears potential safety risks for children.

items.title: Dutch chipmaker NXP expects Q1 2025 revenue below estimates
items.summary:
- NXP Semiconductors forecasts Q1 2025 revenue between US$2.73 billion and US$2.93 billion, below analysts' estimate of US$2.89 billion.
- The decline is attributed to weaker demand in automotive and industrial sectors, impacted by slower EV adoption and high interest rates.
- NXP’s Q4 2024 revenue was US$3.11 billion, slightly exceeding expectations, despite declines in its industrial (22%), automotive (6%), and mobile (2%) segments.
- NXP's stock rose 2% in extended trading despite the cautious forecast.

items.title: Alibaba Cloud integrates DeepSeek’s open-source AI models
items.summary:
- Alibaba Cloud has integrated AI models from DeepSeek into its PAI Model Gallery.
- The collection includes open-source large language models (LLMs) for businesses and developers.
- Users can train and deploy these AI models without coding.
- Featured models include DeepSeek-V3 and DeepSeek-R1, along with distilled versions for efficiency.

items.title: Alphabet eyes $50b for AI, cloud as ad growth slows
items.summary:
- Alphabet, the parent company of Google, is set to report its earnings on February 4.
- Revenue growth is projected to slow in Q4 due to competition and a downturn in advertising.
- Capital expenditures for 2024 are estimated at $50 billion to expand cloud infrastructure and improve AI-driven search features.
- Recent developments include stock hitting $200, warnings about AI competition from China, and significant advancements in quantum technology boosting stock values.

items.title: Israeli drone firm Lowental Hybrid raises $5m seed funding
items.author: Itay Lowental, Netta Lowental
items.summary:
- Lowental Hybrid raised US$5 million in seed funding to commercialize hybrid propulsion technology.
- Funding round led by Ace Capital Partners; included contributions from Nir Zuk and the Israel Innovation Authority.
- Founded in 2018, the company develops hybrid propulsion systems for UAVs and drones.
- Technology combines electric power with fuel-based propulsion for extended operational times and low noise levels.
- Funding aims to enhance the adoption of Lowental’s systems in international markets.

items.title: Trump signs order to create US wealth fund
items.summary:
- On Feb. 3, President Donald Trump signed an executive order to explore a sovereign wealth fund.
- The initiative aims to position the US alongside nations with similar funds for government resource investments.
- The Treasury and Commerce Departments are tasked to draft a plan within 90 days, covering funding sources, strategies, structure, and governance.
- Trump suggested the fund might consider acquiring TikTok, though no further details were given.

items.title: French cybersecurity startup Riot raises $30m series B
items.summary:
- French cybersecurity startup Riot raised $30 million in a series B round, valuing the company at over $170 million.
- The funding round was led by Left Lane Capital and included existing investors Y Combinator, Base10, and FundersClub.
- Riot generated $10 million in annual revenue in 2024 and serves 1 million employees across 1,500 companies, increasing from 100,000 employees.
- Originally focused on employee education regarding phishing, Riot introduced a security chatbot, Albert, for Slack and Microsoft Teams.
- The company plans to launch an Employee Security Posture Management platform to assess and improve security practices.
- The new funding will be used to accelerate growth, open offices in new countries, and expand its customer base.

items.title: US bitcoin funds see $5.25b inflows, BlackRock leads
items.summary:
- In January 2025, US spot bitcoin ETFs saw inflows of approximately $5.25 billion, increasing from $4.53 billion in December.
- BlackRock’s IBIT had the highest inflows at $3.23 billion, raising its net assets to $59.39 billion.
- Fidelity’s FBTC attracted $1.28 billion, bringing its net assets to $21.76 billion.
- Matt Hougan from Bitwise forecasts potential inflows over $50 billion for US spot bitcoin ETFs this year, despite month-to-month volatility.
- Bitcoin prices decreased by 4.2%, trading at $95,500, while Ether fell by 16.5% to $2,591 as of February 3.

items.title: Sam Altman plans healthcare, robotics partnerships in S Korea
items.summary:
- Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, announced plans for a healthcare-focused ChatGPT during a workshop in Seoul on Feb. 4.
- He expressed interest in partnering with Korean companies in the robotics field.
- OpenAI aims to comply with HIPAA regulations to allow healthcare organizations to leverage its technology.
- Altman highlighted Korea's vital role in the AI ecosystem, citing its strengths in semiconductors and energy.

items.title: Ex-Google employees’ productivity startup raises $25m
items.summary:
- Tana, an AI-driven productivity software startup, raises US$25 million in funding.
- The platform automates tasks like note-taking and creates action items by processing data from various sources.
- Founded in 2020 by former Google employees, Tana aims to enhance its AI-assisted knowledge management system.
- Series A funding led by Tola Capital raised US$14 million, with contributions from Lightspeed Venture Partners.
- Previously raised US$11 million in seed funding from investors including La Famiglia and tech leaders Lars Rasmussen and Arash Ferdowsi.
- Tana has over 160,000 users on its waitlist and 30,000 testing its closed beta.
- The company collaborates primarily with OpenAI for natural language processing.

items.title: US-based drone tech startup raises $100m, valued at $500m
items.summary:
- Hidden Level, a US drone defense startup, raised $100 million in funding rounds led by Lockheed Martin Ventures and DFJ Growth.
- The funding increases the company's valuation to nearly $500 million.
- Founded in 2018, Hidden Level specializes in passive radar systems for drone detection without disclosing its location.
- The company secured a 10-year contract with the US Army in 2024, details undisclosed.
- Government clients, especially the US Army and Air Force, represent the majority of revenue, while police and commercial clients account for 20%.
- Revenue reported at $5 million last year, expected to grow to $25 million by 2025.
- Plans for expansion and increased manufacturing capacity with the new funding.

items.title: Ether plunges 27% on tariff threats, biggest drop since 2021
items.summary:
- Ether experienced a significant decline of 27%, marking its biggest drop since 2021.
- The decline is attributed to upcoming tariff threats that may impact the cryptocurrency market.
- Investors are concerned about the potential repercussions of tariffs on the overall financial landscape.

items.title: Trump’s coin earns $100m in trading fees
items.summary:
- Entities behind Trump’s crypto coin earned close to $100 million in trading fees within two weeks of its launch on January 17.
- Estimates of trading fees generated range from $86 million to $100 million as of January 30.
- Over 200,000 wallets, primarily small traders, incurred losses while major investors profited.
- The $Trump coin, managed by various entities including CIC Digital, faces criticism for its ownership structure and potential conflicts of interest.
- Ethics experts express concerns about the mix of business and political affiliations surrounding the coin.

items.title: Thailand to launch crypto sandbox in Phuket by 2025
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Thailand plans to establish a cryptocurrency sandbox in Phuket by October 2025 for foreign nationals to transact with digital assets.
- The initiative, proposed by former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra, aims to enhance tourism and attract digital nomads and investors.
- Cryptocurrency transactions will be permitted in a designated area, including for property purchases, although the use of cryptocurrencies for payments is currently prohibited by the Bank of Thailand.
- The project is part of Thailand's broader push for digital asset innovation, including developments in central bank digital currencies (CBDCs).
- Challenges include the absence of legal frameworks and addressing the volatility and risks associated with cryptocurrencies.

items.title: From the Experts: tackling the top IP challenges for businesses
items.author: Vivian Wei Cheng, Jens Loosen, Matthew English, Yang Jie An, Renee Xavier, Benita Lau, Dominique Christ
items.summary:
- Intellectual property (IP) and intangible assets (IA) are crucial for young businesses, but navigating them is challenging.
- Singapore launched the GoBusiness IP Grow platform to assist companies in accessing IP experts for tailored advice.
- Businesses should secure IP rights early to avoid vulnerability and ensure competitiveness against imitators.
- Registering IP rights enhances legal protection and enforcement options while educating staff on identifying IP violations is essential.
- Legal action is not the only means of protecting IP; collaboration with competitors can also be beneficial.
- Startups must manage IP protection costs effectively, considering staggered filings and focusing on crucial markets.
- The Madrid Protocol offers a cost-effective way for businesses to register trademarks in multiple countries.
